fields.headline: Top opening stands v England
fields.bodyText: 338: Graeme Smith and Herschelle Gibbs (SA), Edgbaston, 2003 Smith and Gibbs punished a lacklustre England attack which struggled to readjust to Test cricket. 329: Geoff Marsh and Mark Taylor (Aus), Trent Bridge, 1989 Marsh (138) and Taylor (219), right, became the first pair to bat through the opening day of a Test in England. 298: Desmond Haynes and Gordon Greenidge (WI), Antigua, 1990 Greenidge (149) and Haynes (167) plundered the first 228 runs in 51 overs on their way to a West Indies record opening stand. 276: Stewie Dempster and John Mills (NZ), Wellington,1930 Dempster and Mills set the record in their country's second-ever Test, and Dempster (136) became the first Kiwi to record a Test hundred. 260: Michael Slater and Mark Taylor (Aus), Lord's, 1993 Slater and Taylor rattled up 101 by lunch, 212 at tea and 260 in all before Slater fell for 152 only 65 minutes from the close.
